text: The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 1 release date and time is quickly approaching, and viewers have become curious about the details. They also wish to know how they can stream this episode online. This episode is titled “Future Days.” The second season, which will adapt the story told in The Last of Us Part II, is set five years after the events of Season 1. Here’s all you need to know. When is The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 1’s release date & time? The episode’s release date is April 13, 2025, and its release time is 9 p.m. Eastern Time (ET) and 6 p.m. Pacific Time (PT). Check out its release times in the U.S. below: TimezoneRelease DateRelease TimeEastern TimeApril 13, 202509:00 p.m.Pacific TimeApril 13, 202506:00 p.m. Find out how many episodes will be available to watch in The Last of Us Season 2 right here. Where to watch The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 1 You can watch The Last of Us Season 2 Episode 1 via HBO and HBO Max. HBO and HBO Max are a pay television service and an OTT platform, respectively, owned by Warner Bros. Discovery. Max offers subscribers a wide variety of film, television, and documentary content. The content provided includes both original and licensed properties. In addition to this, Max also offers content drawn from the libraries of other WB Discovery-owned networks like Adult Swim, Animal Planet, and CNN. What is The Last of Us season 2 about? The Last of Us Season 2 will take place around five years after Season 1’s events. It will see Joel and Ellie’s murky past from Season 1 catch up with them. They will also deal with a much more violent world than what they had dealt with in the first season. The official synopsis for The Last of Us is as follows: “Twenty years after modern civilization has been destroyed, Joel, a hardened survivor, is hired to smuggle Ellie, a 14-year-old girl, out of an oppressive quarantine zone. What starts as a small job soon becomes a brutal, heartbreaking journey, as they both must traverse the United States and depend on each other for survival.”
